item.title: Beer Consumption Analysis
item.description: Which nation consumes the most beer? First, we’ll load all the libraries library(tidyverse) # Load ggplot2, dplyr, and all the other tidyverse packages library(mosaic) library (dplyr) library(ggthemes) library(lubridate) library(fivethirtyeight) library(here) library(skimr) library(scales) library(janitor) library(vroom) library(tidyquant) library(rvest) library(purrr) library(lubridate) library(patchwork) library(gt) library(tidytext) library(ggrepel) Then we’ll select the drinks data from the library. library(fivethirtyeight) data(drinks) Let’s take a glimpse of the data. glimpse(drinks) ## Rows: 193 ## Columns: 5 ## $ country <chr> "Afghanistan", "Albania", "Algeria", "An… ## $ beer_servings <int> 0, 89, 25, 245, 217, 102, 193, 21, 261, … ## $ spirit_servings <int> 0, 132, 0, 138, 57, 128, 25, 179, 72, 75… ## $ wine_servings <int> 0, 54, 14, 312, 45, 45, 221, 11, 212, 19… ## $ total_litres_of_pure_alcohol <dbl> 0.

item.title: IMBD Ratings
item.description: Do Spielberg and Burton have the same IMBD ratings? Null hypothesis: Steven Spielberg and Tim Burton have the same IMDB Ratings. Alternative hypothesis: Steven Spielberg and Tim Burton do not have the same IMDB Ratings library(tidyverse) # Load ggplot2, dplyr, and all the other tidyverse packages library(mosaic) library(ggthemes) library(GGally) library(readxl) library(here) library(skimr) library(janitor) library(broom) library(tidyquant) library(infer) library(openintro) library(tidyquant) library(lubridate) First, let’s read the movies.csv file which contains all the movies and take a look at the data through glimpse.

item.title: Weather Anomalies
item.description: How much have temperatures changed over the past century? First we load all the necessary libraries for this analysis: library(tidyverse) library(mosaic) library(ggthemes) library(lubridate) library(here) library(skimr) library(janitor) library(httr) library(readxl) library(vroom) Then we check out the data provided by NASA through the link below and skip NA variables. weather <- read_csv("https://data.giss.nasa.gov/gistemp/tabledata_v3/NH.Ts+dSST.csv", skip = 1, na = "***") Further, we use the pivot function to adapt the data to our needs.
